document_title: Premature ejaculation: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: xuat-tinh-som.json_5_Treatment and control of premature ejaculation in men
subsection_content:
To treat premature ejaculation effectively, patients need to clearly determine where the cause of premature ejaculation comes from to have appropriate treatment. Treatment of premature ejaculation, in addition to using medication and surgery, can be treated with psychology, exercise, and changes in cognition and daily living habits.
1. Psychological and behavioral control therapy
Learn to adjust behavior: In some cases, patients can treat premature ejaculation by changing their sexual habits. Patients who recognize signs of premature ejaculation need to breathe deeply and slowly to help control their will to inhibit the ejaculation reflex. You should practice many times (4-5 weeks) to become a conditioned reflex.; The stop-start method (interval method) is often applied to many couples. With starting and stopping, your partner will stimulate the penis until ejaculation is imminent. Then, the partner stops until the man regains control. It is advisable to repeat this action twice, then engage in the fourth attempt and allow yourself to ejaculate. According to the American Urological Association, you should try this three times a week until you feel like you can control your ejaculation better.; Squeeze method: With the squeezing method, the partner stimulates the male penis until he is close to ejaculation. Then they squeeze the penis until the erection begins to weaken. This will help you be more aware of the feeling before climax, thereby helping men have better control and delay ejaculation.
2. Treat premature ejaculation with medication
In some cases that cannot be corrected by behavior, premature ejaculation is treated with medication, or both can be combined to achieve the best results.
Depending on the problem a man is experiencing, the doctor will prescribe the appropriate medication
Dapoxetine: is an SSRI drug for premature ejaculation approved in Europe and other countries. Many RCT studies show that Dapoxetine 30mg or 60mg used 1-2 hours before intercourse can improve vaginal ejaculation time, increase ejaculation control, relieve psychological factors and increase satisfaction. sexually satisfied. Besides Dapoxetine, there are also medicinal preparations used for off-label treatment.; Local anesthetic: Using a spray or applying it on the foreskin has a local anesthetic effect, reduces sensation and temporarily delays ejaculation. However, the drug has side effects of heating and burning the foreskin and making the penis itch, which can affect the anesthetic to the partner during sex.; Antidepressants: The side effect of antidepressants is slowing down orgasm, so they are used to treat premature ejaculation. However, this drug has other unwanted effects, including causing nausea and drowsiness; Tramadol pain reliever: In addition to pain relief, the drug also has the ability to delay ejaculation. Use of this drug must be according to prescription because this drug can cause dangerous addiction to the user.; Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors: These include fluvoxamine and citalopram, paroxetine, sertraline or fluoxetine. These medications can be taken daily, helping to prolong ejaculation time by 2 - 10 times. The drug is used for several months. Possible side effects of the drug include fatigue, nausea, muscle weakness, tremors and loose stools. This condition usually appears in the first week and gradually disappears after 2-3 weeks.; Medicines to treat erectile dysfunction when both premature ejaculation and erectile dysfunction occur. PDE5 enzyme inhibitors such as tadalafil (Cialis) and sildenafil (Viagra)... can help men maintain an erection and ejaculate more slowly. Doctors can advise patients to use a combination of dapoxetine and PDE5-i to prolong the time of erection of the penis until ejaculation, in addition to limiting the effects of Dapoxetine on erectile ability during treatment. premature ejaculation.
Note, when using medications to treat premature ejaculation, you need to follow your doctor's instructions to prevent unwanted effects such as dizziness, nausea, blurred vision, constipation, reduced sperm quality, etc.
3. Surgery
Currently, no surgery is considered capable of improving vaginal ejaculation time.
